page.title: 06The Shuttleworth Collection
page.content: { The Shuttleworth Collection}is run by a trust and{owned by the parents of {Richard Shuttleworth},who built it in memory of their son.He had collected some of the planes.He was a World War 2 pilot but was killed in an air crash at the ae of 31. In the collection{there are over 100 {historic machines},most of which are aircraft in airworthy condition. There are examples of 1st and 2nd world war fighter planes,together with very old aircraft and more modern inventions such as the jet engine. The Collection also includes bikes, motor bikes,cars,pony carts and gliders. There is a grass runway to enable planes to land and take off safely. There are facilities which make displays possible,and flying days take place on the last Sunday in the month from April to October.
